main event: An unidentified aerial object was reported over Kirtland Air Force Base, New Mexico on 7 February 1950.
interesting points: The object was observed between 1955 and 2000 hours on 7 February 1950, The object appeared reddish-green and was estimated to be twice the size of the evening star, The sighting lasted approximately 2 to 3 minutes with no visible means of support, The object was described as pear-shaped with a bright reddish-trail, The flight direction was from south southeast to east without any tactical maneuvers.
witness description: One was Dr. Lincoln Lajoie from the University of New Mexico, the other was Captain A. Abernathy, co-pilot of an aircraft.
